text:
@kapur_bharat @VincentRK @DrEricDing Other things 
- Stay home
-Wear a mask if going out is unavoidable
- If you have fever/cough get COVID test if possible
- Do not panic, remdesivir, plasma, CT scan not needed
- Contact doctor/hosp only if difficulty breathing OR oxygens sats <92%

3/ Adds to the growing body of evidence that hydroxychloroquine, antiretrovirals show no benefit in COVID-19, are associated with adverse effects

2/ RCT in Brazil. High risk adult outpatients with COVID randomized to receive Hydroxychloroquine or Lopinavir-Ritonavir or placebo for 9 days. No difference in rates of hospitalization, viral clearance or time to symptom resolution. Trial ended early for futility

1/ No benefit from Hydroxychloroquine or Lopinavir-Ritonavir on Hospitalization/Viral clearance for COVID-19 
https://t.co/yhXxv26418 via @JAMANetworkOpen part of @JAMANetwork
@logisticsXtreme @imarkwright @epigiri No, antibiotics like Levofloxacin or Augmenting will not help COVID pneumonia. Bacterial infection is not very common in COVID

Join me in Twitter Space at 10 pm CST tonight, 830 am Indian Standard Time on April 23, to discuss the COVID situation and ways we can help colleagues in India @camwolfe @VincentRK @d_s_thakur @nramind @Sonali_Advani
@mylaibalki Inhaled steroids won’t protect against Covid. So someone not already on it shouldn’t start taking it to just to prevent Covid. If you have Covid it may prevent it from getting worse.

@imarkwright @epigiri Probably not effective as the breathing discomfort in COVID is not due to bronchospasm (tightening of the airways). Acebrophylline dilates the airways and reduces mucus production
Great pictorial with practical COVID information #COVID19 #CovidIndia https://t.co/6piXqfSYYp

2/ Diagnosed COVID? What next ? 

Check oxygen sats. 
If sats > 90%, reassure
-Paracetamol as needed for fever
-Inhaled steroids (budesonide)
-Continue to follow sats 
-No need for hospitalization
-No need for chest CT

I am getting calls from friends/ family in India about COVID. From neurosurgeons to urologists, doctors are being roped in to handle the crisis. 

1/ Having managed pts with COVID for the last year & having the luxury of time, here are my thoughts for those new to this battle.
